rsbNotes.title: Pr 3:1–12
rsbNotes.text: 3:1–12 These verses are probably a single unit of instruction, with the typical “my son” address repeated in v. 11. The unit contains the usual imperatives (vv. 1, 3, 5–7, 9, 11) and motivating clauses (vv. 2, 4, 8, 10). Verse 12 explains the purpose of the Lord’s discipline, encouraging the wise to follow the precept of v. 11.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 3:9–10
rsbNotes.text: 3:9, 10 Honoring God with the right use of material things expresses gratitude for His favor and recognizes that He controls the natural order and its processes.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 3:9
rsbNotes.text: 3:9 firstfruits. This first part of the annual harvest was given to the priests (Lev. 23:10; Num. 18:12, 13).
